channel.title: How's my website?
channel.description:
I know every Tom, Dick, and Harry have their own website, but here's mine anyways.
[url=http://goons.freepgs.com]My Website[/url]
I hope you like it. I have added so much to it. I used to be like maddox if anybody knows him, and I had over 50 articles that were very popular, but the web server crashed and like an idiot, I didn't have a back up. So I started new and this is what I have so far. Rate out of 5 just to make it easier. I hate rating out of 10. lol.
Vote for my site if you like it, Thank You.
~Ron
Edit: It's valid XHTML 1.1 Transitional if that makes it sound like I did more work lol. I tried to tree the source code, but the PHP and the .tpl files made it kind of confusing in DreamWeaver.

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Shush! lol I'm workin on it. Thanks for the compliment.

Read full topic

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Loz Loz
item.description:
@Loz wrote:

Good for content, but the design could be a lot better.

Read full topic

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I have photoshop, but I'm just too much of a noob lol. I'm doing a tutorial now, and hopefully I'll be able to make something good looking in the near future.

I never heard of corel draw photo paint, but I have heard of and used jasc's paint shop pro. Thanks for the tips though.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Friday13th Friday13th
item.description:
@Friday13th wrote:

If you want to make gr8 graphics then make it whole in a program like Corel Draw Photo Paint or paint Shop Pro.
Anyway I think that the first one is mutch more better

Read full topic

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Haha yeah maybe. I do get a good amount of hits. But I could put the .swf direct links to other people's .swf's and steal their bandwidth lol. Jk jk.

Read full topic

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

Ron:

That's so bad for bandwidth though. Some images are good, but not too many.

Yeah I know

And the content is fine. If you have a good amount of space and bandwith, you should download every .swf file of the flash games/animations and host them directly on your site.

Read full topic

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Hmm. What about content? Doesn't anyone care what's actually inside the website though?

I'll try to work on style and scheme though. Thanks :).

Read full topic

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Friday13th Friday13th
item.description:
@Friday13th wrote:

4/10 ... sorry you need to work on the colors.

If you want to use bright background the colors you use as a graphics have to be bright too.
if you want to use darg background then you can use the full colors.

Read full topic

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

That's so bad for bandwidth though. Some images are good, but not too many.

Read full topic

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

Yeah, I designed my site layout in photoshop, then made hyperlinks and what not in Dreamweaver. My site practically consists of 1 big image, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I don't know. I was going to make the left side's menu links out of flash, that way, googlebot and other search engine bots could detect those links since I don't have a site map.

You're right though. It doesn't flow well. I wish I could improve on it, but I don't know how :(. If I was better at Photoshop I would design the whole site with imaging first, and then make the whole design better. But now it loads fast and has a lot of content. So visually, it's not so hot, but inside it's a hotty lol.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

I'm not really feeling the colors nor the banner... Just doesn't flow well, and why is there 2 sets of navigation links?

Read full topic

item.title: How's my website?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

no one replied...
